contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:KZ''' is the entry for [[Kazakhstan]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for Kazakhstan, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[provinces of Kazakhstan|2 cities and 14 regions]]. The cities [[Almaty]] and [[Astana]] are the former and current capitals of the country respectively and have special status equal to the regions. [[Baikonur]], a city which also has special status as it is currently leased by [[Russia]], had its code deleted in [[#I-4|Newsletter I-4]]. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>KZ</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of Kazakhstan. The second part is three letters. ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). [[ISO 639-1]] codes are used to represent subdivision names in the following [[official language|administrative language]]s: * (kk): [[Kazakh language|Kazakh]] * (ru): [[Russian language|Russian]] — Romanization system: [[BGN/PCGN romanization of Russian|BGN/PCGN]] 1947, [[GOST 16876-71|GOST]] 1983 ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name ([[Kazakh language|kk]]) ! Subdivision name ([[Russian language|ru]])<br /> (BGN/PCGN) ! Subdivision name ([[Russian language|ru]])<br /> (GOST) ! Subdivision category |- | <tt>KZ-ALA</tt> | [[Almaty]] | Almaty | Almaty | city |- | <tt>KZ-AST</tt> | [[Astana]] | Astana | Astana | city |- | <tt>KZ-ALM</tt> | [[Almaty oblysy]] | Almatinskaya oblast' | Almatinskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-AKM</tt> | [[Aqmola oblysy]] | Akmolinskaya oblast' | Akmolinskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-AKT</tt> | [[Aqtöbe oblysy]] | Aktyubinskaya oblast' | Aktjubinskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-ATY</tt> | [[Atyraū oblysy]] | Atyrauskaya oblast' | Atyrauskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-ZAP</tt> | [[Batys Qazaqstan oblysy]] | Zapadno-Kazakhstanskaya oblast' | Zapadno-Kazahstanskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-MAN</tt> | [[Mangghystaū oblysy]] | Mangistauskaya oblast' | Mangystauskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-YUZ</tt> | [[Ongtüstik Qazaqstan oblysy]] | Yuzhno-Kazakhstankaya oblast' | Južno-Kazahstankaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-PAV</tt> | [[Pavlodar oblysy]] | Pavlodarskaya oblast' | Pavlodarskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-KAR</tt> | [[Qaraghandy oblysy]] | Karagandinskaya oblast' | Karagandinskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-KUS</tt> | [[Qostanay oblysy]] | Kostanayskaya oblast' | Kostanajskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-KZY</tt> | [[Qyzylorda oblysy]] | Kyzylordinskaya oblast' | Kyzylordinskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-VOS</tt> | [[Shyghys Qazaqstan oblysy]] | Vostochno-Kazakhstanskaya oblast' | Vostočno-Kazahstanskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-SEV</tt> | [[Soltüstik Qazaqstan oblysy]] | Severo-Kazakhstanskaya oblast' | Severo-Kazahstanskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KZ-ZHA</tt> | [[Zhambyl oblysy]] | Zhambylskaya oblast' | {{sort|Zambylskaja oblast'|Žambylskaja oblast'}} | region |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-2" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-2_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-2}}] | {{nowrap|2002-05-21}} | Addition of one city. Nine name spellings corrected. List source updated | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>KZ-AST</tt> [[Astana]] |- | id="I-3" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-3_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-3}}] | {{nowrap|2002-08-20}} | Error correction: Various spelling corrections | |- | id="I-4" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-4_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-4}}] | {{nowrap|2002-12-10}} | Removal of one city from the list (Bayqongyr) | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions deleted:'''<br /> <tt>KZ-BAY</tt> [[Bayqongyr]] |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of Kazakhstan]] * [[List of FIPS region codes (J-L)#KZ: Kazakhstan|FIPS region codes of Kazakhstan]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/ukz.html Regions of Kazakhstan], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iso 3166-2:Kz}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:KZ]] [[Category:Provinces of Kazakhstan|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:Kazakhstan-related lists]]
